column4: hmm, is there a copy of ndiswrapper on the ubuntu 4.10 cd somewhere? i'd like to install it
ah, so ubuntu installs it by default? excellent
https://www.ubuntulinux.org/support/documentation/howto/ndiswrapper
sadly, that appears to require an internet connection to download ndiswrapper; right now the internet connection is not an option without having ndiswrapper in the first place :(
where does it say that ?
update your repository; plus ndiswrapper-utils doesn't come up in package search in synaptic
hmm, thought it is on the cd
nope
its the instabilities of sid plus the ones of hoary
that sounds scary :(
it is scary, but you see what will be coming up next ;) i.e. 45 boottime or a really fast starting X server etc
easy solved
no ati drivers (from ati) for xorg yet
yeah, that's why i was wondering about the xorginess of hoary... had the same problem with suse 9.2 on the laptop, since suse ships it with xorg by default
i may be wrong, but i think the ati drivers from xorg are ok.....
then wait till april :)
and stay with warty
for the hoary release i mean :)
you got a amd64 ?
lucky you.....
i would consider some bucks for a new card then....
can't really swap the card out in a laptop though
nope, but desnt it have usb or pcmcia ?
so you could swap it with a wlan card ;)
